answers.answer: Did you get checked for food allergies and Celiac disease?You might want to take magnesium citrate 500 mg in the morning and calcium and vitamin D at night to try to regulate your energy.  You may be having trouble relaxing to go to sleep at night from your hectic schedule.  I learned a lot from relaxation therapy with biofeedback.
Make sure they checked your thyroid, too.

question: Ok I am 14 years old and I get these symptoms alot.  When i first started experiencing these symptoms i got checked for diabetes and many other things, all of the results came back negative, but i am still experiencing these symptoms.  I will go into spells of shaking and lose my appetite completely or ill get really dizzy and eat like crazy it just depends on whats going on with me, but i cant quite fiure out what it could be, my mom looked up some of the symptoms and it all came back as lack of sleep.  I have a terrible sleep schedule and have to get up at 5...but im trying to figure out if it could be anyting else or how to stop it?
title: Dizziness, headaches, constant hunger or loss of appetite, uncontrollable shaking, nausea,constant thirst, and nosebleeds
